info.title: NFL v3 Stats
info.description: NFL rosters, player stats, team stats, and fantasy stats API.

get.description: This method returns box scores for all games that are either in-progress or have been updated within the last 30 minutes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Legacy Box Score

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season and the season type. If no season type is provided, then the default is regular season.
Examples: 2015REG, 2015PRE, 2015POST.

parameters.name: week
parameters.description: Week of the season. Valid values are as follows: Preseason 0 to 4, Regular Season 1 to 17, Postseason 1 to 4. Example: 1

parameters.name: hometeam
parameters.description: Abbreviation of the home team. Example: WAS.

get.description: This method returns all box scores for a given season and week.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season and the season type. If no season type is provided, then the default is regular season.
Examples: 2015REG, 2015PRE, 2015POST.

parameters.name: week
parameters.description: Week of the season. Valid values are as follows: Preseason 0 to 4, Regular Season 1 to 17, Postseason 1 to 4. Example: 1

get.description: Daily Fantasy Players

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date of the contest for which you're pulling players 2014-SEP-21, 2014-NOV-15, etc

get.description: Legacy Box Scores Delta (Current Week)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: minutes
parameters.description:
Only returns player statistics that have changed in the last X minutes. You specify how many minutes in time to go back. Valid entries are:
1 or 2.

get.description: This method returns all player game stats, but only returns player stats that have changed in the last X minutes as specified in your API call. By definition this is a live endpoint, not final.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: minutes
parameters.description: Only returns player statistics that have changed in the last X minutes. You specify how many minutes in time to go back. Valid entries are: 1 or 2.

parameters.description: Week of the season. Valid values are as follows: Preseason 0 to 4, Regular Season 1 to 17, Postseason 1 to 4. Example: 1

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Abbreviation of the team. Example: WAS.

get.description: including eligible games, positions, captain mode, players and salaries, for a given week.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season and the season type. If no season type is provided, then the default is regular season.
Examples: 2015REG, 2015PRE, 2015POST.

parameters.name: week
parameters.description: Week of the season. Valid values are as follows: Preseason 0 to 4, Regular Season 1 to 17, Postseason 1 to 4. Example: 1

get.description: Number of the current week of the NFL season. This value usually changes on Tuesday nights or Wednesday mornings at midnight ET but in the rare case of a rescheduled or overseas game with a non-standard gameday this could change.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full scores and gameday info delivered live and post-game. Live data includes down and distance, as well as game clock. Gameday info includes referee, weather, TV channel etc.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.

get.description: Returns true if there is at least one game being played at the time of the request or false if there are none.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full team information: team name and city, conference and division, colors, coaching and scheme info. Also contains basic fantasy info such as IDs as well as full stadium data. This endpoint returns the teams currently active in the league.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Year of the current NFL season. This value changes at the start of the new NFL league year. NFL seasons run across two calendar years; the league year is the one in which it starts, not ends (that is, a season starting in 2023 and ending in 2024 will have the league year of 2023.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Year of the most recently completed NFL season. This value changes immediately after the Super Bowl. NFL seasons run across two calendar years; the league year is the one in which it starts, not ends (that is, a season starting in 2023 and ending in 2024 will have the league year of 2023.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Number of the last completed week of the NFL season. This value usually changes on Tuesday nights or Wednesday mornings at midnight ET but in the rare case of a rescheduled or overseas game with a non-standard gameday this could change.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: This endpoint will return bye weeks - defined as weeks in which a given team does not have a game to play - for each team in the current NFL season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season and the season type. If no season type is provided, then the default is regular season.
Examples: 2015REG, 2015PRE, 2015POST.

get.description: Full scores and gameday info delivered live and post-game. Live data includes down and distance, as well as game clock. Gameday info includes referee, weather, TV channel etc.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season and the season type. If no season type is provided, then the default is regular season.
Examples: 2015REG, 2015PRE, 2015POST.

parameters.name: week
parameters.description: Week of the season. Valid values are as follows: Preseason 0 to 4, Regular Season 1 to 17, Postseason 1 to 4. Example: 1

get.description: Returns all stadiums in the NFL with capacity, surface, latitude/longitude, city and state (and where applicable country.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Home and away teams, date and time, season type and week etc. are included. Also includes gameday information. This includes full stadium information (capacity, lat/long, surface etc.), top-line betting information (spread, moneyline, total), weather conditions, and broadcast information.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.

get.description: Basic RotoBaller news feed, with limited stories available - usually 0-1 stories per day. Ideal for test purposes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Each NFL player has a unique ID assigned by FantasyData. Player IDs can be determined by pulling player related data. Example:14257.

get.description: Basic RotoBaller news feed, with limited stories available - usually 0-1 stories per day. Ideal for test purposes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: Abbreviation of the team. Example: WAS.

get.description: Year of the current NFL season, if we are in the mid-season. If we are in the off-season, then year of the next upcoming season. This value changes immediately after the Super Bowl. NFL seasons run across two calendar years; the league year is the one in which it starts, not ends (that is, a season starting in 2023 and ending in 2024 will have the league year of 2023.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full team information: team name and city, conference and division, colors, coaching and scheme info. Also contains basic fantasy info such as IDs as well as full stadium data. This endpoint returns the active teams for a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season and the season type. If no season type is provided, then the default is regular season.
Examples: 2015REG, 2015PRE, 2015POST.

get.description: Includes regular season standings in division and conference, from which postseason seeding can be derived.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season and the season type. If no season type is provided, then the default is regular season.
Examples: 2015REG, 2015PRE, 2015POST.

get.description: Get detailed information about past, present, and future timeframes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of timeframes to return. Valid entries are current or upcoming or completed or recent or all.

get.description: Full team information: team name and city, conference and division, colors, coaching and scheme info. Also contains basic fantasy info such as IDs as well as full stadium data. This endpoint returns all teams regardless of current active status.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Number of the next upcoming week of the NFL season. This value usually changes on Tuesday nights or Wednesday mornings at midnight ET but in the rare case of a rescheduled or overseas game with a non-standard gameday this could change.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Basic RotoBaller news feed, with limited stories available - usually 0-1 stories per day. Ideal for test purposes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the news.
Examples: 2017-JUL-31, 2017-SEP-01.

get.description: This method returns all box scores for a given season and week, but only returns player stats that have changed in the last X minutes as specified in your API call. You can also filter by type of player stats to include, such as traditional fantasy players, IDP players or all players. by definition this is a live endpoint, not final.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season and the season type. If no season type is provided, then the default is regular season.
Examples: 2015REG, 2015PRE, 2015POST.

parameters.name: week
parameters.description: Week of the season. Valid values are as follows: Preseason 0 to 4, Regular Season 1 to 17, Postseason 1 to 4. Example: 1

parameters.name: playerstoinclude
parameters.description:
The subcategory of players to include in the returned PlayerGame records. Possible values include:

all Returns all players
fantasy Returns traditional fantasy players (QB, RB, WR, TE, K, DST)
idp Returns traditional fantasy players and IDP players.

parameters.name: minutes
parameters.description:
Only returns player statistics that have changed in the last X minutes. You specify how many minutes in time to go back. Valid entries are:
1, 2, etc.

get.description: Full statistical information for a specified game, down to the team and player stat level, delivered live during the game, called for a given team's game in a given week and season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season and the season type. If no season type is provided, then the default is regular season.
Examples: 2015REG, 2015PRE, 2015POST.

parameters.name: week
parameters.description: Week of the season. Valid values are as follows: Preseason 0 to 4, Regular Season 1 to 17, Postseason 1 to 4. Example: 1

parameters.name: hometeam
parameters.description: Abbreviation of a team playing in this game. Example: WAS.

get.description: Full statistical information for a specified game, down to the team and player stat level, delivered live during the game, called per individual game.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: scoreid
parameters.description: The ScoreID of the game. Possible values include: 16247, 16245, etc.

get.description: This method returns the top 300+ IDP Fantasy Players for the current or upcoming season, ordered by AverageDraftPositionIDP.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Returns DFS slates, including eligible games, positions, captain mode, players and salaries, for a given date.

parameters.name: date

The date of the slates.
Examples: 2017-SEP-25, 2017-10-31.

get.description: Gets simulated live box scores of NFL games, covering the Conference Championship games on January 21, 2018.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: numberofplays
parameters.description: The number of plays to progress in this NFL live game simulation. Example entries are 0, 1, 2, 3, 150, 200, etc.

get.description: Gets simulated live scores of NFL games, covering the Conference Championship games on January 21, 2018.
get.summary: Games by Week Simulation (formerly Scores by Week Simulation)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: numberofplays
parameters.description: The number of plays to progress in this NFL live game simulation. Example entries are 0, 1, 2, 3, 150, 200, etc.

parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: numberofgames
parameters.description: How many games to return. Example all, 10, 25
